item.title: Street full of rubbish, 15th October
item.description:
My street has not been swept for over a year.there is litter everywhere.i sweep outside my house but can not sweep the whole street.there are leaves all over that are very slippery for the old people that live here.please could you send a street sweeper.thankyou.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Brindley Street, New Cross, London

item.title: Enormous LBB trees, 15th October
item.description:
Your 3 enormous LBB trees are never maintained. They almost touch my roof now. The thick, enormous branches hang right over my front and back garden. The root of the trees is in my back garden, lifting pathing, which has happened before we moved here, so clearly these trees have been left to take over, without LBB maintenance. You should never have allowed these trees to become so enormous. Why is it our responsibility to pick up the huge quantities of leaf fall on our property from YOUR trees. It will take a storm and these trees could damage our property or a person. You simply do not care. The LBB take huge council tax money from us, yet this appears to only go to your wages. Certainly not your trees or streets. Dog poo also all over the green and you pretend to have cleaned it up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Gravelwood Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 15th October
item.description:

item.title: Dangerous Tree o/s electrical business in St Johns Road, 15th October
item.description:
Dangerous Tree o/s electrical business in St Johns Road that has root problems that is lifting up the concrete causing number 24's boundary wall to collapse...resident has checked on Land Registry and the actual electrical sub station building is owned by London Power Network PLC but the tree it looks like is on public land - please can this be looked into as a matter of urgency as resident's wall is about to come down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Johns Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Who owns these shipping containers?, 15th October
item.description:
My name is Rosa I am Engagement Programme Manager at Thames21 charity who are currently running events at Northbrook Park in collaboration with Lewisham and Glendale. We have a lot of issues currently around storing kit for events and were wondering who owns/uses these containers? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ronver Road, Catford South, London
Report on FixMyStreet
